greet: 'Sup, boyo. Everything running smoothly, don't ya worry. Supplies have arrived an' all. Just here to warn you, though…
The government has put some funding on folks that agree to snitch on bars and speakeasies that still try to serve alcohol, like you.
So keep your eyes peeled, as they say, and watch out for folks that might be looking to make a quick buck, or that really want to get drunk.
I'll be around, boyo. See ya.
Well, well, fella! Lovely weather tonight. The sky is clear, and one can almost see the stars and constellations.
You know, when I was serving in the army during the war, sometimes I would look up at the sky and I would see no stars, because of all the smoke.
Well, I miss some aspects of the military, but the smoke screens are not one of them. Either way, can you make me an Everest now?
correct: This… law that they passed, it's like a smoke screen. Alcohol will always be a part of our lives, and this law won't stop it. It's futile.
It just makes life harder for you bartenders. But thankfully, young people like you know what's right and what's not.
{TRINKET 4}This… is for you. Take good care of it. And goodnight.
water: This… law that they passed, it's like a smoke screen. Alcohol will always be a part of our lives, and this law won't stop it. It's futile.
It just makes life harder for you bartenders. But thankfully, young people like you know what's right and what's not.
{TRINKET 4}This… is for you. Take good care of it. And goodnight.
wrong: Still some improvement to be made with your cocktails, fella… This here is not an Everest, I think.
Well, in any case… Take care, and goodnight.

greet: Hiya! Lovely that you're open tonight, a professor approved one of my papers so I wanted to stop by here to celebrate.
Did you know that humans started making alcoholic beverages thousands of years before the invention of writing? Heh… fellow men of culture…
Alright, can I get a Parti now?
correct: Cheers, love! Tasty as always. I bet it feels less lonely now, knowing you're doing one of the oldest jobs in the world. Take care!
water: Not bad, this drink. And I bet it feels less lonely now, knowing you're doing one of the oldest jobs in the world. Take care!
wrong: Not your best Parti, love. Maybe not even a Parti, heh. But I really have to leave now, so… take care!

greet: Good evening bartender. Oh, it's so nice in here. It's definitely warmer than outside. I know you haven't seen me lately…
[IF HAS POSTERS]That poster outside has an excellent print quality. And it's always nice to see that our work is appreciated by shopkeepers in Korgis.
So… Can I ask for a Ripple as always? Make it extra-alcoholic tonight.
correct: {UNDERCOVER CATCHES YOU}A lot of alcohol in here… Thank you, bartender. And apologies in advance.
wrong: It's not a Ripple. I can't tell the ingredients, actually…
Sorry, I have to go. Goodbye, bartender, and I hope to see you again.
water: Argh… I can't tell if you put any alcohol at all in this.
Which is… good. We're in prohibition after all. Sorry, I have to go. Goodbye, bartender, and I hope to see you again.

greet: [IF MARGARET GOT DRUNK]Hiii! Bartender, I'm so happy tonight! The girl I had a crush on… made the first move on me! And she confessed!!
[IF MARGARET GOT DRUNK]We have our first date tonight, and I want to celebrate with a drink at my favorite bar!
[IF MARGARET DIDN'T GET DRUNK]Hiii! Bartender, I hope everything is going smoothly here! Work today felt a little different than usual.
By the way, why is this bar called {BAR NAME}? Just curious, is all. It is very creative!
I work as propmaker, so creativity is essential in our field. Oh but, while I'm chatting, can I order a Magazine?
correct: [IF MARGARET GOT DRUNK]Thanks a lot! I feel more relaxed now, so it's time for me to meet my date. Bye bye!
[IF MARGARET DIDN'T GET DRUNK]Thanks a lot! I feel more relaxed now. Have a nice evening, bartender!
water: [IF MARGARET GOT DRUNK]Thanks! I feel a tiny bit more relaxed now, so it's time for me to meet my date. Bye bye!
[IF MARGARET DIDN'T GET DRUNK]Thanks! I feel a tiny bit more relaxed now. Have a nice evening, bartender!
wrong: Well, thanks… I'm not sure you got the order right, hmm…

greet: Good evening to you, esteemed bartender. With all these people coming and going from this establishment, you must be a bit stressed out.
Perhaps not as tired as a housewife like myself, however. Oh, you know… Tell one house servant to cook, tell another to rinse the clothes, and so on.
A flowery Palmera is what I need now. Using a freshly picked flower from Brazil would be best, if that's possible for you, bartender.
But I'll… settle for something from Korgis City if you don't have that.
correct: Excellent. Not that I expected any less of you. I dare say that this bar is slowly becoming our best choice. I'm sure that Charles agrees.
water: It's fine. With the excellent taste in music to be found in this bar, I dare say that this is slowly becoming our best bar of choice.
wrong: Not at all what I expected for a Palmera. At least, however, you have excellent taste in music. Which is why I don't mind entering this bar when I pass by.

greet: Good evening. Bartender, I'm sure you must be very busy in the evening, but…
You should watch the latest movie in which Margaret Brookside is starring. It should be called "A Little Lie", if I'm not mistaken.
And I'll tell you a secret while you make me a Barber: both her and I are very passionate fans of Margaret.
correct: Thank you. I know I can count on your discretion and on the quality of these cocktails, when I wish for a little booze. Farewell.
water: Thank you. I know I can count on your discretion when I want a little booze. Farewell.
wrong: I'm afraid you messed up the preparation, bartender. But no worries, no need to make it again. Farewell.

greet: Look who it is! How goes it? Met any snitches? Well, surely not, 'cause I told you about them in time.
I basically… snitched on a snitch. Whoops. Anyway.
I gave you a helping hand today, I'm supplying you on time and with stable prices… Now it's time that you fulfill your part of the deal.
You know… it's not cheap to look after all our business partners and such. So a little sum is all I ask. I'd say something like $50.
Good deal if you ask me. That undercover snitch could've made you close up for good if you hadn't known any better. So, do you have the money?
choice1: {PAYOFF ACCEPTED}I knew I could count on a fellow businessman. Let's keep collaborating, huh?
And hey, don't use up all the booze, hah! Try to water down some drinks here and there. Also keeps the police down.
choice2: {PAYOFF REFUSED}So… after all I've done… Ya think ya can pull this off, huh? Alright, no problem. No problem at all.
Deal is off. I didn't say you could walk back from it, but that's what you're doing to me right now.
We go our separate ways, I guess. I can't assure you any protection now, boyo. Whatever happens to you, happens.
